Articles.Content:
A quick stock build of an I-153 "Chaika" (seagull?) biplane I made. Wing-tips are not the curved shape that they were IRL (same with horizontal and vertical stabilizers)

And (like all other WWII prop aircraft builds that I plan on doing/have done), some engine detailing (very sparse though, and no way to see it unless crashed or in editor)

There are still some issues with "shimmering" due to part clipping

I've also been working on a Spitfire, Me 163, and a Fw 190 A, and am going to take a break from aircraft construction for awhile. Any plane requests for later?

 

Edited February 4, 2016 by TheSpaceManiac
Pretty cool. I like the detail.

12 minutes ago, TheSpaceManiac said:

A quick stock build of an I-153 "Chaika" (seagull?) biplane I made. Wing-tips are not the curved shape that they were IRL (same with horizontal and vertical stabilizers)

And (like all other WWII prop aircraft builds that I plan on doing/have done), some engine detailing (very sparse though, and no way to see it unless crashed or in editor)

There are still some issues with "shimmering" due to part clipping

I've also been working on a Spitfire, Me 163, and a Fw 190 A, and am going to take a break from aircraft construction for awhile. Any plane requests for later?

 

Nice looking aircraft mate. Simple yet detailed. If you want to remove a lot of the shimmer use the rotate tool, hold the mouse button down and drag the mouse away, this will allow you to move it in minute increments. Turn each part minutely and the shimmer will lessen. It will be almost impossible to see that they are slightly rotated.

9 minutes ago, Majorjim said:

Nice looking aircraft mate. Simple yet detailed. If you want to remove a lot of the shimmer use the rotate tool, hold the mouse button down and drag the mouse away, this will allow you to move it in minute increments. Turn each part minutely and the shimmer will lessen. It will be almost impossible to see that they are slightly rotated.

Ok, thanks, it seems to work.

1 hour ago, batman78781 said:

Pretty cool. I like the detail. 

Thanks!

Damn, that engine.

But can you make the cockpit? New challenge .

Ah yes, this plane.....

The fat Russian biplane that anhiliates everything in its path and has access to wing mounted rockets in War Thunder. 

Looks to me like you forgot the Death Star superlasers that thing has for weapons, and I would probably use structural plates to better represent the 10 inch titanium armor plating that plane has covering its entire body.

Seriously, the USSR had the best armored army, most troops, amazing navy, and a top-notch air force. They were amazing.

Also, you play War Thunder too? Noice!

On WT Live I posted my "Derp" edition that has no less than 8 ShVAK cannons and unhistorical 'ramjets' (aka Junos, I couldn't find anything better)

If I encounter these things in War Thunder, I just boom and zoom them to bits

The cockpit is currently just an EVA seat, but @Matuchkin I actually might as well add some greebling for controls...

The ridiculous "sekrit dokument" I-153... (uses BDA and Aviation Arsenal plus KAX)
